questions.article:
The following text is from John Matheus's 1925 novel Fog. The story happens in a city where heavy fog has set in.

The little conductor stood on tiptoe in an effort to keep one hand on the signal rope, craning his neck in a vain and dissatisfied endeavor to pierce the miasma of the fog. The motorman chafed in his box, thinking of the drudging lot of the laboring man. He registered discontent.
questions.question: As used in the text, what does the word “registered” most nearly mean?

options.name: A
options.content: enrolled

options.name: B
options.content: valued

options.name: C
options.content: disregarded

options.name: D
options.content: displayed

questions.correct: displayed
questions.solution:
翻译：
以下文字节选自约翰・马修斯 1925 年的小说《雾》。故事发生在一座浓雾弥漫的城市。
小个子售票员踮起脚尖，努力用一只手抓住信号绳，伸长脖子，徒劳又不满地试图穿透这雾气。司机在驾驶室里烦躁不安，想着劳工们辛苦的命运。他流露出不满情绪。
在文中，“registered” 一词最接近以下哪个意思？
解析：
文中描述司机心里想着劳工辛苦，然后 “registered discontent” ，结合语境是说司机表现出、流露出不满情绪， register有流露表现出的意思。
  • A 选项 “enrolled” ：意思是 “登记；注册” ，与文中表达的 “流露出（情绪）” 意思不符。
  • B 选项 “valued” ：意为 “重视；珍视” ，不符合语境。
  • C 选项 “disregarded” ：是 “忽视；不理会” 的意思，和原文逻辑不符。
  • D 选项 “displayed” ：表示 “展示；表现出” ，“displayed discontent” 即 “表现出不满” ，符合原文语境。
综上，正确答案是 D。
文中火车司机对现状不满，“registered” 在此处应表示 “表现出” 不满，最接近 “displayed” 的意思。
正确答案是 D。

questions.article:
The following text is from John Matheus's 1925 novel Fog. The story happens in a city where heavy fog has set in.

The little conductor stood on tiptoe in an effort to keep one hand on the signal rope, craning his neck in a vain and dissatisfied endeavor to pierce the miasma of the fog. The motorman chafed in his box, thinking of the drudging lot of the laboring man. He registered discontent.
questions.question: As used in the text, what does the word “registered” most nearly mean?

options.name: A
options.content: enrolled

options.name: B
options.content: valued

options.name: C
options.content: disregarded

options.name: D
options.content: displayed

questions.correct: displayed
questions.solution:
翻译：
以下文字节选自约翰・马修斯 1925 年的小说《雾》。故事发生在一座浓雾弥漫的城市。
小个子售票员踮起脚尖，努力用一只手抓住信号绳，伸长脖子，徒劳又不满地试图穿透这雾气。司机在驾驶室里烦躁不安，想着劳工们辛苦的命运。他流露出不满情绪。
在文中，“registered” 一词最接近以下哪个意思？
解析：
文中描述司机心里想着劳工辛苦，然后 “registered discontent” ，结合语境是说司机表现出、流露出不满情绪， register有流露表现出的意思。
  • A 选项 “enrolled” ：意思是 “登记；注册” ，与文中表达的 “流露出（情绪）” 意思不符。
  • B 选项 “valued” ：意为 “重视；珍视” ，不符合语境。
  • C 选项 “disregarded” ：是 “忽视；不理会” 的意思，和原文逻辑不符。
  • D 选项 “displayed” ：表示 “展示；表现出” ，“displayed discontent” 即 “表现出不满” ，符合原文语境。
综上，正确答案是 D。
文中火车司机对现状不满，“registered” 在此处应表示 “表现出” 不满，最接近 “displayed” 的意思。
正确答案是 D。

questions.article: Although fewer companies trade their stocks on the Tehran Stock Exchange in Tehran, Iran, than on the stock exchanges in London, Mumbai, or Tokyo, the Tehran Stock Exchange has the advantage of focusing on local companies and thus reflecting economic circumstances that are ______ Iran. This sensitivity to unique, rapidly evolving local conditions benefits the companies and investors alike.
questions.question: Which choice completes the text with the most logical and precise word or phrase?

options.name: A
options.content: irrelevant to

options.name: B
options.content: prohibitive in

options.name: C
options.content: distinctive to

options.name: D
options.content: unchanging in

questions.correct: distinctive to
questions.solution:
翻译：
尽管在伊朗德黑兰证券交易所进行股票交易的公司数量，比在伦敦、孟买或东京证券交易所交易的公司数量少，但德黑兰证券交易所的优势在于聚焦本地公司，从而反映出____伊朗的经济情况。这种对独特且快速变化的本地情况的敏感性，使公司和投资者都受益。
解析：
  • A 选项 “irrelevant to” ：意思是 “与…… 无关” 。如果经济情况与伊朗无关，就无法体现德黑兰证券交易所聚焦本地公司的优势，不符合语境。
  • B 选项 “prohibitive in” ：表示 “在…… 方面禁止性的；抑制性的” 。文中没有提及经济情况在伊朗是禁止性或抑制性相关内容，该选项不合适。
  • C 选项 “distinctive to” ：意为 “为…… 所特有的” 。德黑兰证券交易所聚焦本地公司，能反映出伊朗特有的经济情况，符合文中 “独特的本地情况” 这一表述，逻辑合理。
  • D 选项 “unchanging in” ：意思是 “在…… 方面不变的” 。但文中提到本地情况是 “快速变化的” ，该选项与原文矛盾。
综上，正确答案是 C。

questions.article: In a study by Mika R. Moran, Daniel A. Rodriguez, and colleagues, residents of Caracas, Venezuela, and of Fortaleza, Brazil, were surveyed about parks in their cities. Of the 1,043 respondents from Caracas, 44.7% indicated that they use the city's parks, and of the 938 respondents from Fortaleza, 35.7% indicated using city parks. It may be tempting to assume the difference is due to different levels of access to parks: however, given that the percentage of Caracas respondents who reported living within a 10-minute walk of a park was much lower than that reported by Fortaleza respondents, greater proximity alone can't explain the difference in park use.
questions.question: Which choice best describes the function of the underlined portion in the text as a whole?

options.name: A
options.content: It introduces a counterexample to the scenario described earlier in the text.

options.name: B
options.content: It provides context to help understand the scope of the researchers' survey.

options.name: C
options.content: It marks a shift from a discussion of the researchers’ conclusion to a discussion of their methods.

options.name: D
options.content: It presents a potential explanation for the team's findings that the text goes on to refute.

questions.correct: It presents a potential explanation for the team's findings that the text goes on to refute.
questions.solution:
翻译：
在米卡・R・莫兰、丹尼尔・A・罗德里格斯及同事开展的一项研究中，对委内瑞拉加拉加斯和巴西福塔莱萨的居民进行了关于城市公园的调查。在来自加拉加斯的 1043 名受访者中，44.7% 的人表示会使用城市公园；在来自福塔莱萨的 938 名受访者中，35.7% 的人表示会使用城市公园。人们可能会倾向于认为这种差异是由于公园可达性不同造成的：然而，鉴于加拉加斯报告称居住在距离公园步行 10 分钟范围内的受访者比例远低于福塔莱萨的受访者，仅靠更近的距离并不能解释公园使用情况的差异。
题目翻译：
4. 以下哪个选项最能描述文中划线部分在整体文本中的作用？
解析：
  • 划线句提出一种可能的解释，即认为两个城市公园使用比例差异是公园可达性不同导致的，但后文通过对比居住在公园附近的受访者比例，说明仅靠距离近不能解释差异，也就是对划线句的解释进行了反驳。
  • A 选项：划线句不是反例，反例是用来反驳某个观点的具体事例，这里只是一种假设的解释，该选项错误。
  • B 选项：划线句没有提供关于研究范围的背景信息，该选项错误。
  • C 选项：文中没有从研究结论转向研究方法的讨论，该选项错误。
  • D 选项：准确指出划线句呈现了一种对研究结果的潜在解释，且后文进行了反驳，符合文意。

综上，正确答案是 D。

questions.article: The following text is adapted from Anton Chekhov's 1899 play Uncle Vanya. Professor Serebrakoff retires and moves to his country estate, which Vanya manages with the help of Sonia, the professor's daughter from a previous marriage. Chekhov portrays the professor as being someone unable to adjust to living at the country estate, as is evident when ______
questions.question: Which quotation from Uncle Vanya most effectively illustrates the claim?

options.name: A
options.content: Professor Serebrakoff says, "I am a book-worm and a scholar, and am unfamiliar with practical affairs. I cannot, I find, dispense with the help of well-informed people."

options.name: B
options.content: Professor Serebrakoff says to Helena, "My darling, don't leave me alone with [Vanya]. He will begin lecture me."

options.name: C
options.content: Professor Serebrakoff says to Helena, "I am used to my library and the lecture hall and to the esteem and admiration of my colleagues. Now I suddenly find myself plunged into this wilderness(the cottage), condemned to see the same stupid people from morning till night and listen to their futile conversations."

options.name: D
options.content: Vanya says to Professor Serebrakoff, "You write on art without knowing anything about it. Those books of yours which I used to admire are not worth one copper kopeck. You are a hoax!"

questions.correct: Professor Serebrakoff says to Helena, "I am used to my library and the lecture hall and to the esteem and admiration of my colleagues. Now I suddenly find myself plunged into this wilderness(the cottage), condemned to see the same stupid people from morning till night and listen to their futile conversations."
questions.solution:
A 选项中教授说自己是书虫和学者，不熟悉实际事务，没有体现对乡村生活的适应；
B 选项中教授让海伦娜不要留下他和万尼亚单独相处，没有体现对乡村生活的适应；
C 选项中教授说自己习惯了图书馆和讲堂，现在却身处乡村，体现了对乡村生活的不适应；
D 选项是万尼亚对教授的指责，没有体现教授对乡村生活的适应。
正确答案是 C。

questions.article:
The following text is from Jerome K. Jerome's 1889 novel Three Men in a Boat.

We are creatures of the sun, we men and women. We love light and life. That is why we crowd into the towns and cities, and the country grows more and more deserted every year. In the sunlight—in the daytime, when Nature is alive and busy all around us, we like the open hillsides and the deep woods well enough: but in the night, when our Mother Earth has gone to sleep, and left us waking, oh! the world seems so lonesome, and we get frightened, like children in a silent house. Then we sit and sob, and long for the gas-lit streets, and the sound of human voices, and the answering throb of human life.
questions.question: Which choice best states the main purpose of the text?

options.name: A
options.content: To indicate that crowded areas can cause people to feel as though they are children again.

options.name: B
options.content: To caution people not to be so quick to dismiss the natural beauty that can be found in rural areas.

options.name: C
options.content: To address common traits that motivates many people to choose to live in urban environments.

options.name: D
options.content: To illustrate the idea that most people tend to prefer hillsides in the country to certain aspects of towns and cities.

questions.correct: To address common traits that motivates many people to choose to live in urban environments.
questions.solution:
A 选项 “表明拥挤的地区会让人们感觉自己像孩子一样”；
B 选项 “告诫人们不要轻易忽视乡村地区能发现的自然美”；
C 选项 “阐述促使许多人选择生活在城市环境中的共同特征”；
D 选项 “说明大多数人在某些方面更倾向于乡村的山坡而不是城镇和城市”。
文中强调人们热爱光明和生活，所以涌入城镇，C 选项符合文意。
正确答案是 C。

questions.article: Falcons and horses can see in three dimensions (3D), which helps them perceive distance and depth. Octopuses and squid are thought to lack 3D vision. Many researchers once thought the same about cuttlefish, but Trevor Wardill and his team wanted to test whether this assumption was true. The team studied how cuttlefish wearing 3D glasses reacted to 3D images of shrimp (a favorite prey) projected on a tank wall. Cuttlefish changed their striking position to match the 3D images, suggesting that their vision is more like that of falcons and horses than that of octopuses or squid.
questions.question: Which choice best describes the main idea of the text?

options.name: A
options.content: Cuttlefish eyes are much more complex than those of falcons or horses.

options.name: B
options.content: Wardill's team designed 3D glasses for cuttlefish.

options.name: C
options.content: Before completing their study, Wardill's team thought that cuttlefish have 3D vision, but horses may not.

options.name: D
options.content: The finding of Wardill's team's study suggests like falcons and horses, cuttlefish may also have 3D vision.

questions.correct: The finding of Wardill's team's study suggests like falcons and horses, cuttlefish may also have 3D vision.
questions.solution:
A 选项 “乌贼的眼睛比猎鹰或马的眼睛复杂得多”，文中未提及眼睛复杂程度的比较；
B 选项 “沃迪尔的团队为乌贼设计了 3D 眼镜”，文中没有提到设计 3D 眼镜这一内容；
C 选项 “在完成研究之前，沃迪尔的团队认为乌贼有 3D 视觉，但马可能没有”，文中并没有这样的表述；
D 选项 “沃迪尔团队的研究结果表明，像猎鹰和马一样，乌贼可能也有 3D 视觉”，符合文章主要内容。
正确答案是 D。

questions.article: President Richard Nixon is most famous for his participation in the 1970s Watergate political scandal, a convoluted tale of criminality and eroded ethics involving a constellation of associates such as White House Counsel Chuck Colson and White House Counsel John Dean. But Nixon's legacy is complex: he has been praised for his role in creating the Environmental Protection Agency, and he once made an attempt at reforming United States health care policy that is arguably a precursor to the Affordable Care Act, which became law during the Barack Obama administration.
questions.question: Which choice best states the main idea of the text?

options.name: A
options.content: Chuck Colson and John Dean were significant figures in the presidency of Richard Nixon.

options.name: B
options.content: Richard Nixon is commonly linked with an infamous historical event, but this overshadows some of his notable achievements.

options.name: C
options.content: Some of Richard Nixon's policies influenced the policies of later presidential administrations.

options.name: D
options.content: Richard Nixon's reputation is primarily due to the actions of his associates.

questions.correct: Richard Nixon is commonly linked with an infamous historical event, but this overshadows some of his notable achievements.
questions.solution:
A 选项 “查克・科尔森和约翰・迪恩是理查德・尼克松总统任期内的重要人物”，文中虽提及二人，但这不是主要思想；
B 选项 “理查德・尼克松通常与一个臭名昭著的历史事件联系在一起，但这掩盖了他的一些显著成就”，符合文章主要内容，既提到了水门事件，又提到了他的正面成就；
C 选项 “理查德・尼克松的一些政策影响了后来总统任期的政策”，文中虽有提及，但不是主要在强调政策影响；
D 选项 “理查德・尼克松的声誉主要归因于他的同僚的行为”，不符合文章主旨。
正确答案是 B。

questions.article: Cane is a 1923 novel by Jean Toomer. In one portion of the novel, Toomer uses figurative language to connect the narrator's urban environment of Washington, DC, and the rural South of the narrator's past, writing ______
questions.question: Which quotation from Cane most effectively illustrates the claim?

options.name: A
options.content: “The [train] engines of this valley have a whistle, the echoes of which sound like iterated gasps and sobs. I always think of them as crude music.”

options.name: B
options.content: “And when the wind is from the South, soil of my homeland falls like a fertile shower upon the lean streets of [Washington, DC].”

options.name: C
options.content: “I sang, with a strange quiver in my voice, a promise-song.”

options.name: D
options.content: “The young trees had not outgrown their boxes then. V Street [in Washington, DC] was lined with them.”

questions.correct: “And when the wind is from the South, soil of my homeland falls like a fertile shower upon the lean streets of [Washington, DC].”
questions.solution:
A 选项描述了山谷中的火车引擎声，没有体现城市与乡村的联系；
B 选项提到当风从南方吹来，故乡的土壤像肥沃的阵雨落在华盛顿特区的街道上，体现了南方乡村与华盛顿特区城市的联系；
C 选项描述唱歌的情景，没有体现城市与乡村的联系；
D 选项描述年轻的树没有长过箱子，V 街排列着这些树，没有体现城市与乡村的联系。
正确答案是 B。

questions.article: Many believe that lullabies, characterized by their less steady beat, contain some acoustic features that are universally calming to infants. In a study, Constance M. Bainbridge and colleagues played both a lullaby sung in the Western Nahuatl language and a non-lullaby sung in the Serbian language to a group of infants. The researchers also measured the infants' heart rates, as a reduced heart rate is considered a measure of relaxation. They claim that the lullaby did indeed relax the infants.
questions.question: Which finding, if true, would most directly support Bainbridge and colleagues claim?

options.name: A
options.content: The heart rates of infants in the study were more irregular during the lullabies than during non-lullabies.

options.name: B
options.content: Parents of infants in the study chose the lullaby over the non-lullaby when asked which song they Infants' use to calm their child.

options.name: C
options.content: Infants’ heart rates were substantially lower during the lullaby than during the non-lullaby.

options.name: D
options.content: Both the song in Western Nahuatl and the song in Serbian were sung by a female singer.

questions.correct: Infants’ heart rates were substantially lower during the lullaby than during the non-lullaby.
questions.solution:
A 选项 “研究中婴儿在听摇篮曲时的心率比听非摇篮曲时更不规则”，这与摇篮曲能让婴儿放松的说法相悖；
B 选项 “研究中婴儿的父母在被问及用什么歌来安抚孩子时选择了摇篮曲而非非摇篮曲”，这是父母的主观选择，并非直接证据；
C 选项 “婴儿在听摇篮曲时的心率明显低于听非摇篮曲时”，这直接支持了摇篮曲能让婴儿放松（心率降低）的说法；
D 选项 “西部纳瓦霍语和塞尔维亚语的歌曲都是由女性歌手演唱的”，与摇篮曲的安抚效果无关。
正确答案是 C。

questions.article:
Contributions of Three Key Industries to Oklahoma Economy in 2017

The Cherokee Nation, the Seminole Nation, and the more than thirty other tribes in Oklahoma operate numerous businesses and collectively generate billions of dollars in revenue. In fact, when the tribes' economic activity is regarded as a single industry, its contribution to the Oklahoma economy in 2017 ______
questions.question: Which choice uses data from the table to most effectively complete the comparison?

options.name: A
options.content: surpassed the contribution made by administration/waste but fell short of that made by real estate.

options.name: B
options.content: exceeded the contribution made by both administration/waste and real estate.

options.name: C
options.content: was greater than the contribution made by real estate but equal to that made by administration/waste.

options.name: D
options.content: was lower than the contribution made by either administration/waste or real estate.

questions.correct: surpassed the contribution made by administration/waste but fell short of that made by real estate.

questions.article: Water flowing around an obstruction creates vortices (patterns of swirls) of varying size; by detecting the vortices, fish can determine the size and position of the obstruction. Testing by Yuzo R. Yanagisuru, Otar Akanyeti, and James C. Liao using models of three head shapes—narrow (low ratio of width to length), intermediate, and wide (high ratio of width to length)—showed that for large vortices, fish with intermediate heads would be better able than narrow-headed fish to distinguish between vortices and general turbulence in the water. A second research team has therefore hypothesized that in low-visibility conditions, intermediate-headed fish will be more likely than narrow-headed fish to detect obstructions that create large vortices.
questions.question: Which finding, if true, would most directly support the second research team's hypothesis?

options.name: A
options.content: A study using obstructions that created large vortices in low-visibility conditions found that the narrow-headed lake sturgeon (Acipenser fulvescens) bumped into obstructions more often than the intermediate-headed dusky smooth-hound (Mustelus canis) did.

options.name: B
options.content: A study using obstructions that created large vortices in low-visibility conditions found that the lake sturgeon (Acipenser fulvescens), which has a relatively narrow head, bumped into more than half of the obstructions.

options.name: C
options.content: A study using obstructions that created large vortices in low-visibility conditions found that some specimens of the intermediate-headed dusky smooth-hound (Mustelus canis) bumped into the obstructions more often than other specimens of the same fish did.

options.name: D
options.content: A study using obstructions that created large vortices in low-visibility conditions found that the intermediate-headed dusky smooth-hound (Mustelus canis) avoided more than half of the obstructions.

questions.correct: A study using obstructions that created large vortices in low-visibility conditions found that the narrow-headed lake sturgeon (Acipenser fulvescens) bumped into obstructions more often than the intermediate-headed dusky smooth-hound (Mustelus canis) did.
questions.solution:
A 选项 “一项在低能见度条件下使用产生大漩涡的障碍物进行的研究发现，窄头的湖鲟（Acipenser fulvescens）比中头的灰星鲨（Mustelus canis）更频繁地撞到障碍物。”，这直接支持了中头鱼在低能见度下更能探测障碍物的假设；
B 选项 “一项在低能见度条件下使用产生大漩涡的障碍物进行的研究发现，湖鲟（Acipenser fulvescens）（头相对较窄）撞到超过一半的障碍物。”，这只说明了窄头鱼的情况，没有与中头鱼对比；
C 选项 “一项在低能见度条件下使用产生大漩涡的障碍物进行的研究发现，一些中头的灰星鲨（Mustelus canis）比同一种鱼的其他个体更频繁地撞到障碍物。”，没有与窄头鱼对比；
D 选项 “一项在低能见度条件下使用产生大漩涡的障碍物进行的研究发现，中头的灰星鲨（Mustelus canis）避开了超过一半的障碍物。”，没有与窄头鱼对比。
正确答案是 A。

questions.article: In a college course on urban affairs, a student asserts that increased traffic congestion in the 1990s in the United States was present both in very large cities such as New York City, New York, and smaller areas such as Albuquerque, New Mexico, Jacksonville, Florida, and Boise, Idaho; though those smaller areas may have been less affected by traffic congestion than very large cities, this congestion also worsened in them over time.
questions.question: Which choice best describes data from the graph that support the student's claim?

options.name: A
options.content: In at least one of the four urban areas shown, the amount of traffic delay was less than 20 hours per commuter per year at one point between 1990 and 2000.

options.name: B
options.content: While the annual number of hours of traffic delay per commuter was always lower in the Boise, Idaho, area than in the New York City, New York, area for each year between 1990 and 2000, the amount of traffic delay rose in both areas during this period.

options.name: C
options.content: Even though the amount of traffic delay per commuter per year was greater in the Albuquerque, New Mexico, area than in the New York City, New York, area throughout the period from 1990 to 2000, the amounts were nearly identical in 1996.

options.name: D
options.content: In 1992, the amount of traffic delay in the New York City, New York, area was less than 30 hours per commuter per year.

questions.correct: While the annual number of hours of traffic delay per commuter was always lower in the Boise, Idaho, area than in the New York City, New York, area for each year between 1990 and 2000, the amount of traffic delay rose in both areas during this period.
questions.solution:
A 选项 “在 1990 年到 2000 年之间，至少有一个四个城市区域显示交通延误量每通勤者每年少于 20 小时。”，与图表不符，图表中各城市交通延误量都超过 20 小时；
B 选项 “虽然 1990 年到 2000 年期间，爱达荷州博伊西每通勤者每年的交通延误小时数总是低于纽约市，但在此期间这两个地区的交通延误量都在上升。”，符合图表数据，纽约市和博伊西的交通延误量都在增加；
C 选项 “尽管 1990 年到 2000 年期间，新墨西哥州阿尔伯克基每通勤者每年的交通延误量大于纽约市，但在 1996 年这两个地区的量几乎相同。”，图表中并没有显示 1996 年两者几乎相同；
D 选项 “1992 年，纽约市每通勤者每年的交通延误量少于 30 小时。”，图表中 1992 年纽约市交通延误量超过 30 小时。
正确答案是 B。

questions.article:
Ranking of Environmental and Sociocultural Benefits of Urban Agriculture (scale of 1 to 25; 1=highest)

Esther Sanye-Mengual, Kathrin Specht, and their team surveyed three groups of people in Bologna, Italy—leaders of urban agriculture projects, stakeholders in urban agriculture (e. g., food researchers and urban farming associations), and the general public—to compare their views about the extent to which urban agriculture contributes to 25 social or ecological services that the team identified. The researchers used these ratings to rank the services for each group, with a conclusion that both stakeholders and general public regard the improvement of attitudes and outlooks as important benefit of urban agriculture.
questions.question: Which choice best describes data in the table that support the city planner's conclusion?

options.name: A
options.content: The improvement of physical health was ranked lower for the general public than it was for project leaders.

options.name: B
options.content: The provision of raw materials was ranked higher for the general public than was the improvement of attitudes and outlooks.

options.name: C
options.content: The improvement of attitudes and outlooks was ranked higher for stakeholders than it was for the general public.

options.name: D
options.content: The improvement of attitudes and outlooks was ranked higher for the general public than were the other four services.

questions.correct: The improvement of attitudes and outlooks was ranked higher for the general public than were the other four services.
questions.solution:
A 选项 “普通公众对身体健康改善的评级低于项目领导者”；
B 选项 “普通公众对原材料供应的评级高于态度和观念的改善”；
C 选项 “利益相关者对态度和观念改善的评级高于普通公众”；
D 选项 “普通公众对态度和观念改善的评级高于其他四项服务”。
根据表格，普通公众对态度和观念改善的评级为 4，高于其他四项服务（食物供应 8、原材料供应 15、身体健康改善 7、污染增强 12），D 选项正确。
正确答案是 D。

questions.article: Like many other fruit-eating birds on the Hawaiian island of Oahu, the red-whiskered bulbul helps forest plants spread by dropping seeds from the plants' fruits in different spots (a process called seed dispersal). Ecologists have found that fruit-eating birds disperse some seeds from native plants at risk of extinction in the wild, such as the lapalapa tree. However, the birds disperse a higher number of seeds from nightblooming jessamine shrubs and other non-native plants with large populations, likely because there are so many more of those plants for them to choose from. Therefore, it isn't surprising that ______
questions.question: Which choice most logically completes the text?

options.name: A
options.content: On Oahu, the rate of population increase is higher for non-native plants than it is for vulnerable native forest plants, like lapalapa trees.

options.name: B
options.content: Night-blooming jessamine shrubs and other non-native forest plants only recently began to outnumber native forest plants in the wild.

options.name: C
options.content: On Oahu, native plants, such as the lapalapa tree, are already growing in most of the spots where red-whiskered bulbuls would be likely to drop plant seeds on Oahu.

options.name: D
options.content: The lapalapa tree and the night-blooming jessamine shrub are the plant species most in danger of going extinct in the wild.

questions.correct: On Oahu, the rate of population increase is higher for non-native plants than it is for vulnerable native forest plants, like lapalapa trees.
questions.solution:
A 选项 “在瓦胡岛，非本土植物的种群增长率高于本土的脆弱森林植物，如拉拉帕树。”，与前文提到鸟更多地传播非本土植物种子相呼应，逻辑连贯；
B 选项 “夜间开花的茉莉灌木和其他非本土森林植物只是最近才开始在野外数量超过本土植物。”，文中未提及数量超过本土植物的时间问题；
C 选项 “在瓦胡岛，本土植物，如拉拉帕树，已经在大多数红嘴相思鸟可能掉落植物种子的地方生长。”，与前文逻辑不符；
D 选项 “拉拉帕树和夜间开花的茉莉灌木是在野外最有灭绝危险的植物种类。”，文中只提到拉拉帕树有灭绝危险，未提及茉莉灌木。
正确答案是 A。

questions.article: Cut, bent, and welded from discarded metal materials, the sculptures of London-based Nigerian artist Sokari Douglas Camp are meant to challenge viewers to consider their own relationships to material ______ her thought provoking works in the 1993 exhibition Steel Clothes and Ornamentation at the Redfern Gallery in London were no different.
questions.question: Which choice completes the text so that it conforms to the conventions of Standard English?

options.name: A
options.content: wastes;

options.name: B
options.content: wastes and to

options.name: C
options.content: wastes,

options.name: D
options.content: wastes

questions.correct: wastes;

questions.article: A recipient of the Othmer Gold Medal and the Davy Medal from the Royal Society, ______ known as femtochemistry when he devised an optical spectroscopy technique that allowed researchers to study ultrafast chemical reactions occurring within molecules.
questions.question: Which choice completes the text so that it conforms to the conventions of Standard English?

options.name: A
options.content: the result of chemist Ahmed Zewail's expansion of the limits of measurability was the introduction of a new scientific discipline

options.name: B
options.content: the introduction of a new scientific discipline by chemist Ahmed Zewail led to the expansion of the limits of measurability

options.name: C
options.content: the limits of measurability were expanded by chemist Ahmed Zewail who introduced a new scientific discipline

options.name: D
options.content: chemist Ahmed Zewail expanded the limits of measurability and introduced a new scientific discipline

questions.correct: chemist Ahmed Zewail expanded the limits of measurability and introduced a new scientific discipline
questions.solution:
A 选项 “化学家艾哈迈德・泽维尔对可测量极限的扩展的结果是引入了一门新的科学学科”，表述较为复杂和混乱；
B 选项 “化学家艾哈迈德・泽维尔引入的一门新的科学学科导致了可测量极限的扩展”，逻辑不符合原文；
C 选项 “可测量极限被化学家艾哈迈德・泽维尔扩展了，他引入了一门新的科学学科”，表述较复杂；
D 选项 “化学家艾哈迈德・泽维尔扩展了可测量极限并引入了一门新的科学学科”，简洁明了地表达了原文的意思，符合语法规范。
正确答案是 D。

questions.article: The Amur River, which is 2,714 miles long, ______ into the Sea of Okhotsk.
questions.question: Which choice completes the text so that it conforms to the conventions of Standard English?

options.name: A
options.content: flow

options.name: B
options.content: flows

options.name: C
options.content: have flowed

options.name: D
options.content: are flowing

questions.correct: flows
questions.solution:
A 选项 “flow” 是动词原形，不符合主语为单数的情况；
B 选项 “flows” 是动词 “flow” 的第三人称单数形式，符合语法；
C 选项 “have flowed” 是现在完成时，不符合语境；
D 选项 “are flowing” 是现在进行时，不符合语境。
正确答案是 B。

questions.article: What is the origin of the word “pessimism”? Interestingly, ______ It first appears in a letter by English author Samuel Taylor Coleridge.
questions.question: Which choice completes the text so that it conforms to the conventions of Standard English?

options.name: A
options.content: it was invented by an author.

options.name: B
options.content: it was invented by an author?

options.name: C
options.content: wasn't it invented by an author.

options.name: D
options.content: was it invented by an author.

questions.correct: it was invented by an author.
questions.solution:
A 选项 “it was invented by an author.” 是陈述句，符合语法；
B 选项 “it was invented by an author?” 是疑问句，不符合；
C 选项 “wasn't it invented by an author.” 是反义疑问句，不符合；
D 选项 “was it invented by an author.” 是疑问句，不符合。
正确答案是 A。

questions.article: After much debate, ______ finally made a decision: the judges for the 1974 Nobel Prize in Literature would award Eyvind Johnson of Sweden with that year's prize “for a narrative art, far-seeing in lands and ages, in the service of freedom.”
questions.question: Which choice completes the text so that it conforms to the conventions of Standard English?

options.name: A
options.content: you

options.name: B
options.content: it

options.name: C
options.content: anyone

options.name: D
options.content: they

questions.correct: they
questions.solution:
A 选项 “you”（你；你们）不符合语境；
B 选项 “it”（它）是单数，不符合；
C 选项 “anyone”（任何人）不符合语境；
D 选项 “they”（他们）是复数，符合指代评委们的语境。
正确答案是 D。

questions.article: Today, the Michelin Guide is widely known as the arbiter of fine dining, with its coveted 3-star rating being awarded to top restaurants like Xin Rong Ji in Beijing. However, few know the guide started as a marketing gimmick in 1900, when brothers Andre and Edouard Michelin sought to increase profits for their tire company by encouraging their customers to ______ their cars across France, visiting the guide’s recommended hotels and restaurants along the way.
questions.question: Which choice completes the text so that it conforms to the conventions of Standard English?

options.name: A
options.content: drive.

options.name: B
options.content: drive

options.name: C
options.content: drive:

options.name: D
options.content: drive;

questions.correct: drive
questions.solution:
A 选项 “drive.”（句点多余）；
B 选项 “drive”（动词原形，符合语法）；
C 选项 “drive:”（冒号多余）；
D 选项 “drive;”（分号多余）。
正确答案是 B。

questions.article: Pinon Chapter is one of the 110 chapters of the Navajo Nation (Naabeeho Bincihdsdzo). The chapter, known as Be'ek'id Bas Ahoodzdni in the Navajo language (Dine Bizaad), was the subject of a profile ______ in the Navajo Times on December 12, 2013.
questions.question: Which choice completes the text so that it conforms to the conventions of Standard English?

options.name: A
options.content: appearing

options.name: B
options.content: appears

options.name: C
options.content: has appeared

options.name: D
options.content: appeared

questions.correct: appearing
questions.solution:
A 选项 “appearing”（现在分词形式，作后置定语，符合语法）；
B 选项 “appears”（动词第三人称单数形式，不符合语法）；
C 选项 “has appeared”（现在完成时，不符合语法）；
D 选项 “appeared”（过去式，不符合语法）。
正确答案是 A。

questions.article: Writer Silvia Moreno-Garcia’s love of short fiction began when she read a collection of Edgar Allan Poe stories as a child, and she later would become a prolific short story writer herself, publishing pieces like “In the Details” (2015) and “To See Pedro Infante” (2014). Yet she's best ______ especially since her 2020 novel Mexican Gothic reached the New York Times Best Sellers list—as a novelist.
questions.question: Which choice completes the text so that it conforms to the conventions of Standard English?

options.name: A
options.content: known

options.name: B
options.content: known:

options.name: C
options.content: known—

options.name: D
options.content: known;

questions.correct: known—

questions.article: In 1931, scientists first isolated a sample of the steroid hormone androsterone, which they knew existed in animals—and, they assumed, only in animals. ______ researchers would find androsterone in Swiss cheese plants (Monstera deliciosa), but this discovery wouldn't come until decades later.
questions.question: Which choice completes the text with the most logical transition?

options.name: A
options.content: For example,

options.name: B
options.content: Eventually,

options.name: C
options.content: In other words,

options.name: D
options.content: Earlier,

questions.correct: Eventually,
questions.solution:
A 选项 “For example,”（例如）用于举例，这里不适用；
B 选项 “Eventually,”（最终）表示时间上的推移，符合逻辑；
C 选项 “In other words,”（换句话说）用于解释说明，这里不适用；
D 选项 “Earlier,”（早些时候）与文意不符。
正确答案是 B。

questions.article: The first documented use of the English word “muzzle” is attributed to poet Geoffrey Chaucer's 1385 work The Knight's Tale. However, Chaucer didn't write in Modern English; ______ he wrote in what we now call Middle English, which was commonly used during the period.
questions.question: Which choice completes the text with the most logical transition?

options.name: A
options.content: as a result,

options.name: B
options.content: similarly,

options.name: C
options.content: rather,

options.name: D
options.content: finally,

questions.correct: rather,
questions.solution:
A 选项 “as a result,”（结果）用于表示因果关系，这里不适用；
B 选项 “similarly,”（同样地）用于表示相似情况，这里不适用；
C 选项 “rather,”（而是）用于表示转折和纠正，符合逻辑；
D 选项 “finally,”（最终）用于表示顺序，这里不适用。
正确答案是 C。

questions.article:
While researching a topic, a student has taken the following notes:

  • Jean-Michel Basquiat was an American artist who produced more than two thousand drawings and paintings.
  • His work Thin in the Old was completed in 1986 and sold at auction in 2020.
  • Thin in the Old is composed of acrylic, oil, and paper collage on wood and measures 3,028 square inches in area.
  • His work Victor was completed in 1987 and sold at auction in 2017.
  • Victor is composed of acrylic, oil stick, and crayon on canvas and measures 9,432 square inches in area.
questions.question: Which choice most effectively uses information from the given sentences to emphasize how the two works are similar?

options.name: A
options.content: Composed by artist Jean-Michel Basquiat in 1986 and 1987, respectively, both Thin in the Old and Victor use acrylic paint as a medium.

options.name: B
options.content: Artist Jean-Michel Basquiat completed Thin in the Old in 1986, and Victor followed in 1987.

options.name: C
options.content: Artist Jean-Michel Basquiat's work Thin in the Old is composed of acrylic, oil, and paper collage, while Victor is composed of acrylic, oil stick, and crayon.

options.name: D
options.content: Between artist Jean-Michel Basquiat's works Victor and Thin in the Old, the former is the larger of the two.

questions.correct: Composed by artist Jean-Michel Basquiat in 1986 and 1987, respectively, both Thin in the Old and Victor use acrylic paint as a medium.
questions.solution:
A 选项 “分别由艺术家让 - 米歇尔・巴斯奎特在 1986 年和 1987 年创作，《瘦老头》和《维克多》都使用丙烯酸涂料作为媒介。”，强调了两件作品创作时间接近且都使用丙烯酸涂料；
B 选项 “艺术家让 - 米歇尔・巴斯奎特在 1986 年完成了《瘦老头》，《维克多》在 1987 年完成。”，只提到了创作时间，没有强调相似之处；
C 选项 “艺术家让 - 米歇尔・巴斯奎特的作品《瘦老头》由丙烯酸、油和纸拼贴构成，而《维克多》由丙烯酸、油画棒和蜡笔构成。”，侧重于材料的不同；
D 选项 “在艺术家让 - 米歇尔・巴斯奎特的作品《维克多》和《瘦老头》中，前者面积更大。”，侧重于大小比较。
正确答案是 A。

questions.article:
While researching a topic, a student has taken the following notes:

  • The Mohs scale of mineral hardness is a ten-point scale that orders minerals by hardness based on their ability to scratch other minerals.
  • Minerals with larger numbers are harder than minerals with smaller numbers and can leave visible scratches on them.
  • Minerals with smaller numbers are softer than minerals with larger numbers and cannot leave visible scratches on them.
  • The mineral talc has a Mohs scale number of 1.
  • The mineral fluorite has a Mohs scale number of 4.
  • The mineral topaz has a Mohs scale number of 8.
questions.question: The student wants to compare the hardness of talc and topaz. Which choice most effectively uses relevant information from the notes to accomplish this goal?

options.name: A
options.content: Topaz can leave visible scratches on fluorite, which is why topaz has a higher number than fluorite on the Mohs scale of mineral hardness.

options.name: B
options.content: The Mohs scale of mineral hardness can be used to order fluorite, talc, and topaz by their ability to scratch other minerals.

options.name: C
options.content: A mineral with a Mohs number of 4, like fluorite, is harder than one with a Mohs number of 1, like talc.

options.name: D
options.content: Topaz can leave visible scratches on talc, which means that topaz is harder than talc.

questions.correct: Topaz can leave visible scratches on talc, which means that topaz is harder than talc.
questions.solution:
A 选项 “黄玉能在萤石上留下可见划痕，这就是为什么黄玉在莫氏硬度标度上的数值比萤石高。”，没有涉及滑石；
B 选项 “莫氏硬度标度可根据矿物刮擦其他矿物的能力对萤石、滑石和黄玉进行排序。”，没有具体比较滑石和黄玉；
C 选项 “莫氏硬度值为 4 的矿物（如萤石）比莫氏硬度值为 1 的矿物（如滑石）更硬。”，没有直接比较滑石和黄玉；
D 选项 “黄玉能在滑石上留下可见划痕，这意味着黄玉比滑石硬。”，直接利用笔记中的原理比较了滑石和黄玉的硬度。
正确答案是 D。
